item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, February 22, 2025 at 3:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Who needs a sneaker bot when AI can hallucinate a win for you? (27 points | 3 comments)
2. Apple pulls data protection tool after UK government security row (1030 points | 749 comments)
3. Paxlovid: You'd have expected more (50 points | 35 comments)
4. Richard Feynman's blackboard at the time of his death (1988) (244 points | 127 comments)
5. Why Ruby on Rails still matters (244 points | 188 comments)
6. Google Titans Model Explained: The Future of Memory-Driven AI Architectures (95 points | 24 comments)
7. The Ren'Py Visual Novel Engine (129 points | 43 comments)
8. Yocto, RockPi and SBOMs: Building modern embedded Linux images (96 points | 46 comments)
9. Math Academy, part 1: My eigenvector embarassment (31 points | 19 comments)
10. Show HN: Slime OS – An open-source app launcher for RP2040 based devices (83 points | 4 comments)
11. Reality has a surprising amount of detail (2017) (252 points | 130 comments)
12. Launch HN: Massdriver (YC W22) – Self-serve cloud infra without the red tape (54 points | 41 comments)
13. Johnny.Decimal – A system to organise your life (321 points | 179 comments)
14. Surface-Stable Fractal Dither on Playdate (21 points | discuss)
15. Sparse Voxels Rasterization: Real-Time High-Fidelity Radiance Field Rendering (59 points | 13 comments)
16. Waste-based perovskite solar cell achieves 21.39% energy efficiency (34 points | 16 comments)
17. Docker limits unauthenticated pulls to 10/HR/IP from Docker Hub, from March 1 (373 points | 390 comments)
18. Every .gov Domain (302 points | 246 comments)
19. DeepDive in everything of Llama3: revealing detailed insights and implementation (122 points | 8 comments)
20. Suckless.org: software that sucks less (223 points | 118 comments)
21. Start a Computer Club in the Place That You Live (7 points | discuss)
22. 20 years working on the same software product (274 points | 93 comments)
23. Train Your Own O1 Preview Model Within $450 (387 points | 60 comments)
24. Can you lose your native tongue? (2024) (36 points | 50 comments)
25. SVDQuant+NVFP4: 4× Smaller, 3× Faster FLUX with 16-bit Quality on Blackwell GPUs (16 points | 3 comments)
26. I found a backdoor into my bed (624 points | 289 comments)
27. Posh (YC W22) Is Hiring ( | hide)
28. General Reasoning: Free, open resource for building large reasoning models (61 points | 12 comments)
29. Some critical issues with the SWE-bench dataset (305 points | 105 comments)
30. A Vending Machine, on the Internet (10 points | discuss)
